de.desy.language.editor.core.parser
Class Node

java.lang.Object
  de.desy.language.editor.core.parser.Node

public abstract class Node
extends Object

A node in the outline tree for exactly one document.

Author:
C1 WPS / KM, MZ

Node

public Node()
Method Detail

getChildrenNodesAsArray

@Deprecated
public final Node[] getChildrenNodesAsArray()
Deprecated. Use getChildrenNodes().

Gives the children of this node.

Returns:
A not-null array of nodes which are the children of this node (this array may be empty!).

getChildrenNodes

public final Collection<Node> getChildrenNodes()
Gives the children of this node.

Returns:
A not-null Set of nodes which are the children of this node.

hasChildren

public final boolean hasChildren()
Determines if this node has children.

getStatementEndOffset

public final int getStatementEndOffset()
Gives the statements ending index in the source. Pay attention, this index may not be accurate if changes happens since the last call of save. To enable this feature, you have to set the offsets by internally calling setStatementOffsets(int, int).

Returns:
An index >= 0.

getStatementStartOffset

public final int getStatementStartOffset()
Gives the statements beginning index in the source. Pay attention, this index may not be accurate if changes happens since the last call of save. To enable this feature, you have to set the offsets by internally calling setStatementOffsets(int, int).

Returns:
An index >= 0.

hasOffsets

public final boolean hasOffsets()
Indicates if source offsets of the statement are avail. To enable this feature, you have to set the offsets by internally calling setStatementOffsets(int, int).

humanReadableRepresentation

public abstract String humanReadableRepresentation()
Gives the name to be shown for this note.

Returns:
A not null non empty string.

toString

public final String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class Object

setStatementOffsets

protected final void setStatementOffsets(int start,
                                         int end)
Used to internally set the offsets of a statement in the source.

Parameters:
start - The start offset (>= 0)
end - The end offset (>= 0, end > start)

addChild

public final void addChild(Node child)
Adds a child node to this node. Currently this is only done be the parser which uses the statement contents to determine the child-nodes. This is done to avoid a hierarchical structure of the parser-process.

containsErrors

public final boolean containsErrors()
Checks if this node contains any error messages.

Returns:
true if and only if error messages are added to this node, false otherwise.

containsWarnings

public final boolean containsWarnings()
Checks if this node contains any warning messages.

Returns:
true if and only if warning messages are added to this node, false otherwise.

addError

public final void addError(String errorMessage)
Adds a new error message to this node.

Parameters:
errorMessage - The not-null, non-empty error message to be added.

addWarning

public final void addWarning(String warningMessage)
Adds a new warning message to this node.

Parameters:
errorMessage - The not-null, non-empty warning message to be added.

getAllWarningNodes

public final Set<Node> getAllWarningNodes()
Gives all nodes beginning with this one and including all children-node which contains warnings. The current may not be present in resulting list, if the current node does not contains warnings.

Returns:
A not-null but possible empty set containing all significant nodes; the result is an unmodifiable view on a set.

getAllErrorNodes

public final Set<Node> getAllErrorNodes()
Gives all nodes beginning with this one and including all children-node which contains errors. The current may not be present in resulting list, if the current node does not contains errors.

Returns:
A not-null but possible empty set containing all significant nodes; the result is an unmodifiable view on a set.

getErrorMessages

public final Set<String> getErrorMessages()
Returns a unmodifiable view on a Set of error messages.

Returns:
A not-null, possible empty Set of errors.

getWarningMessages

public final Set<String> getWarningMessages()
Returns a unmodifiable view on a Set of warning messages.

Returns:
A not-null, possible empty Set of warnings.
